summary: xylometazoline hydrochloride (HCl) is a nasal decongestant that causes vasoconstriction in the nasal submucosa. it is used as the active component in the antiviral nasal spray Coldamaris prophylactic (1.2 mg/mL iota-carrageenan in 0.5% NaCl) and other medical device nasal sprays approved and marketed in the EU. iota-carrageenan demonstrated that the substances do not influence each other. xylometazoline hydrochloride (HCl) is a well-established nasal decongestant. it acts selectively on -adrenergic receptors (alpha-adrenergic agonists) three main forms of carrageenan are commercially used: iota-, kappa- and lambda-carrageenan. they differ in the degree of sulfation, solubility and gelling properties. the antiviral mechanism of carrageenan is based on the interference with viral attachment: carrageenan forms a barrier on the mucosal surface. the intranasal (i.n.) topical application provides reliable and fast relief from the symptoms of nasal congestion and facilitates breathing during common cold/flu-like illnesses and allergic rhinitis. also facilitates drainage of the secretion during sinusitis and can be used as an adjuvant treatment of mucosal swelling due to otitis media. all animals were bred for experimental purposes according to art. 9.2, No. 7 of the German Act on Animal Welfare. the studies were authorized under the BSL BIOSERVICE GmbH licenses to conduct repeated dose toxicity studies granted by the government of Upper Bavaria, Germany. ometazoline HCl 0.5 Carr_0.12% Base formulation Iota-carrageenan 1.2 Xylo_0.05%/Carr_0.12% minutes at room temperature before a suspension of chicken red blood cells was added. positive control RBCs in the absence of the test sample were fully agglutinated by the virus. inhibition of hemagglutination was observed in wells containing a sufficient amount of iota-carrageenan to inhibit virus binding to RBCs. study was performed by ThioMatriX GmbH (innsbruck, Austria) with the test essential medium (Sigma-Aldrich, Vienna, Austria) supplemented with 10% fetal bovine serum (Sigma-Aldrich) and 1% antibiotic–antimycotic mix (Sigma-Aldrich) in an incubator at 37°C a medium containing at the same concentrations as during the virus pre-incubation period. fertilized eggs were placed in a motor-driven egg incubator at 37.5°C to start embryonic development. on embryo development day, 5 eggs were rotated and stored with blunt end up. on EDD 6, 1–1.5 mL of albumen was extracted from a punctured hole near the pointed end of the egg. 6 H2O, 4.56 mM KCl, 119.8 mM NaCl, 15 mM NaHCO3, 10 positive control RBCs in the absence of the test sample were fully agglutinated by the virus. inhibition of hemagglutination was observed in wells containing a sufficient amount of iota-carrageenan to inhibit virus binding to RBCs. samples with a size of 3–4 cm2 of freshly excised bovine respiratory mucosa of the nasal cavity were inserted in ussing-type chambers displaying a permeation area of 0.64 cm2.28 The apical side of the tissue was therefore facing the donor compartment. the integrity of the bovine nasal mucosa was proven by transepithelial electrical resistance measurements. all studies and tests were carried out in fivefold at least. the wet weight of a set of tissues was taken, and a set of organs/tissues was preserved. a full histopathology was carried out only on nasal cavities (including turbinates, left and right nostrils), brain (including bulbus olfactorius, medulla/pons cerebellar and cerebral cortex) xylometazoline HCl was tested against hRV1a and hRV8. a maximum xylometazoline HCl concentration of 16.7 g/mL was obtained. all iota-carrageenan-containing solutions showed a comparable antiviral effectiveness. the ability of hCoV OC43 to agglutinate chicken erythrocytes can be dose dependently inhibited by iota-carrageenan. this is used in the HAI assay to evaluate the antiviral efficacy of iota-carrageenan-containing test samples. iota-carrageenan retains its antiviral effectiveness in the presence of xylometazoline HCl. the CAM is a highly vascularized membrane that surrounds the developing chicken embryo. the CAM is a highly Na-Flu was used as the positive control, and fluorescein-labeled dextran with a molecular mass of 500 kDa (FD-500) was used as the negative control. xylometazoline HCl was quantified using ussing-type xylometazoline HCl without iota-carrageenan (Xylo_0.05%) permeated the tissue. Xylo_0.05%/Carr_0.12% was applied three times/day at a dose/application of 70 g xylometazoline HCl and 168 g iota-carrageenan. a three-time daily administration of neither Xylo_0.05%/Carr_0.12% nor Xylo_0.05% was associated with any clinical symptoms in male or female rabbits. no gross pathological abnormalities or abnormal organ weights of toxicological concern were found in animals treated with Xylo_0.05%/Carr_0.12% or Xylo_0.05%. a slightly higher thymus, epididymides, prostate and ovary weight was also associated with treatment with Xylo_0.05%. iota-carrageenan is effective against a wide range of viruses, enveloped (herpes simplex viruses 1 and 2, human cytomegalovirus, vesicular stomatitis virus, Sindbis virus, influenza virus and human immunodeficiency virus9) and non-enveloped (hRV,21 human papillomavirus10) ones. this rules out a specific interaction of iota-carrageenan with viral nasal mucociliary clearance (NMC) time was determined in 5 healthy volunteers. two nasal spray formulations containing glycyrrhizin as a taste marker with and without 0.18% iota-carrageenan were prepared and blinded. investigations on the compatibility of xylometazoline HCl and iota-carrageenan demonstrated that iota-carrageenan does not impair the efficacy and safety of xylometazoline HCl.
